We therefore used flow cytometry (FC) to rapidly distinguish, sort and collect the putative Botryococcus microfossils from defined sediment horizons, as previously performed for pollen grains
28 and diatom frustules
29 . Preserved DNA was extracted from this material and sequenced using next generation Illumina sequencing. Sequences were aligned against a reference B. braunii genome
30 , providing unequivocal, molecular evidence of the identity of the microfossils. The combination of FC purification and DNA sequencing has wider applications to other microfossil species and the interpretation of their fossil record.
